saadadb.vo.tap
Class TAPToolBox

java.lang.Object
  saadadb.vo.tap.TAPToolBox

public class TAPToolBox
extends java.lang.Object

This class gathers some useful functions to build a TAP service.
Example:
public class ATapServlet extends HttpServlet {
public void doGet(HttpServletRequest req, HttpServletResponse res) throws ServletException, IOException {
// Get the http request parameters:
TAPParameters params = TAPToolBox.getParamsMap(req);

// Set the appropriate content type:
res.setContentType(TAPToolBox.getContentType(params.format));

// Execute the query and format the result in the output of this servlet:
TAPToolBox.executeTAPQuery(params.query, false, params.format, res.getOutputStream());
// OR Execute the query and format the result in a file:
FileOutputStream resultFile = new FileOutputStream(new File("result"+TAPToolBox.getFormatExtension(params.format)));
TAPToolBox.executeTAPQuery(params.query, false, params.format, resultFile);
}
}

Version:
04/2010, 07/2011 getContentType and getFormat moved to VOResultformator
Author:
Grégory Mantelet (CDS)

Method Detail

executeTAPQuery

public static void executeTAPQuery(java.lang.String query,
                                   boolean saadaQL,
                                   java.lang.String format,
                                   int limit,
                                   java.lang.String outputDir,
                                   java.lang.String reportFile)
                            throws java.io.IOException,
                                   java.lang.Exception
Executes the given query and format its result in function of the given format. Uses the new VO request framework. Do not support XSL transformations: Make no sense in AJAX context

Parameters:
query - The query to execute (ADQL or SaadaQL).
saadaQL - Indicates whether the given query is in SaadaQL else it is supposed to be in ADQL.
format - The result format (VOTABLE (default), HTML, CSV, TSV).
limit - Result size limit.
outputDir - Output directory.
outputFile - Output file name.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - If the format is HTML it is needed to write a temporary file and thus a IOException may occur.
java.lang.Exception - If an error occurs during the query execution.

executeTAPQuery

public static void executeTAPQuery(java.lang.String query,
                                   boolean saadaQL,
                                   java.lang.String format,
                                   int limit,
                                   java.io.OutputStream output)
                            throws java.io.IOException,
                                   java.lang.Exception
Executes the given query and format its result in function of the given format.

Parameters:
query - The query to execute (ADQL or SaadaQL).
saadaQL - Indicates whether the given query is in SaadaQL else it is supposed to be in ADQL.
format - The result format (VOTABLE (default), HTML, CSV, TSV).
res - The HTTP response in which the result must be written.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - If the format is HTML it is needed to write a temporary file and thus a IOException may occur.
java.lang.Exception - If an error occurs during the query execution.

formatInText

public static void formatInText(long[] oids,
                                java.lang.String[] columns,
                                java.lang.String columnSeparator,
                                java.io.OutputStream output)
                         throws java.lang.Exception
Format the response corresponding to the given list of oid in the specified text format (for now only: CSV and TSV).

Parameters:
oids - A list of oid.
columns - Columns which must be valued in the formatted result.
columnSeparator - The string that must separate each column value.
output - The stream in which the formatted result must be written.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception -
  • An IOException if it's impossible to get a valid Writer object from the given HttpServletResponse.
  • A FatalException if an oid isn't associated with a SaadaInstance object.
  • An Exception if a column doesn't exist or if it's impossible to get its value.

formatInText

public static void formatInText(SaadaQLResultSet rs,
                                java.lang.String columnSeparator,
                                java.io.OutputStream output)
                         throws java.lang.Exception
Format the given result in the specified text format (for now only: CSV and TSV).

Parameters:
rs - The results to format in text.
columnSeparator - The string that must separate each column value.
output - The stream in which the formatted result must be written.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception -
  • An IOException if it's impossible to get a valid Writer object from the given HttpServletResponse.
  • A FatalException if an oid isn't associated with a SaadaInstance object.
  • An Exception if a column doesn't exist or if it's impossible to get its value.

transformXMLToHTML

public static final void transformXMLToHTML(java.lang.String xmlSrcPath,
                                            java.lang.String htmlDestPath,
                                            java.lang.String xsltPath)
                                     throws java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                                            javax.xml.transform.TransformerException
Transforms the given XML file (xmlSrcPath) into the given HTML file (htmlDestPath) thanks to the given XSLT file (xsltPath).

Parameters:
xmlSrcPath - The path of the XML file to transform in HTML.
htmlDestPath - The path of the file which will be the HTML version of the given XML file.
xsltPath - The path of the XSLT file to use to do the transformation.
Throws:
java.io.FileNotFoundException - If it's impossible to create a stream from one of the three given path.
javax.xml.transform.TransformerException - If there is a problem during the transformation.

transformXMLToHTML

public static final void transformXMLToHTML(java.lang.String xmlSrcPath,
                                            java.io.OutputStream htmlDest,
                                            java.lang.String xsltPath)
                                     throws java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                                            javax.xml.transform.TransformerException
Transforms the given XML file (xmlSrcPath) in HTML into the given stream (htmlDest) thanks to the given XSLT file (xsltPath).

Parameters:
xmlSrcPath - The path of the XML file to transform in HTML.
htmlDest - The stream in which the HTML version of the given XML file must be sent.
xsltPath - The path of the XSLT file to use to do the transformation.
Throws:
java.io.FileNotFoundException - If it's impossible to create a stream from one of the three given path.
javax.xml.transform.TransformerException - If there is a problem during the transformation.
